benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/credits - Create a credit

covered: Valid Payload: The tests cover creation with valid payloads (TC01–TC04, TC07).

Invalid Payload: Comprehensive coverage for malformed JSON, missing fields, invalid IDs, invalid currency, invalid pluginProperty, empty body, and extraneous fields (TC11, TC12, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC21, TC22, TC19, TC20).
Edge & Boundary Conditions: Empty body (TC21), maximum items (TC23), large payloads (TC24), and timeouts (TC25).
Authorization & Headers: Missing/invalid authentication covered (TC18) and required header checks (TC10).
Server/Integration Errors: Service/plugin unavailability and plugin errors (TC17, TC28, TC29).
Regression & Compatibility: Idempotency (TC30) and backward compatibility (TC31).
Performance & Load: Response-time targets and peak-load tests (TC32–TC34).
Stateful Scenarios: Database state variations (TC26, TC27).
Documentation & Observability: API documentation accessibility (TC35) and plugin interaction tests (TC05).
gaps: Caching behavior: No tests asserting caching headers on POST responses.
Rate limiting: No explicit per-second throttling tests; only general load tests.
401 Unauthorized: Missing authentication (missing credentials) not explicitly tested (only 403 for insufficient permissions).
Internal server error coverage: No explicit 500 DB/connection failure tests beyond plugin-related errors.
GET path: No tests covering retrieval of created credits to confirm end-to-end flow.
recommendations: Add a dedicated 401 Unauthorized test (missing credentials) to distinguish from 403.
Add explicit rate-limiting tests (429) for bursts.
Add caching header validations (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST responses if applicable.
Add explicit 500 Internal Server Error tests by simulating DB/connection failures.
Add end-to-end tests that fetch created credits via GET to validate persistence.
Enhance observability tests by asserting audit/log entries for create operations and plugin interactions.
Expand invalid-input cases (e.g., invalid number formats, mixed-type fields) to strengthen validation.
